description:
Allied Sports is hiring a Senior Director of Partnership Development to join our fast-growing team and lead revenue driven opportunities for Allied Sports’ prestigious property clients.

The Senior Director of Partnership Development will be a key member of the Allied Sports Partnership Development team with a proven track record for sourcing, developing, and closing in the sale of large-scale, integrated marketing partnerships for a growing portfolio of clients.

Responsibilities
• Work as part of the Allied Sports Partnership Development Team to pursue prospects through initial contact strategy, development and delivery of sales presentations, negotiation, and contract execution
• Responsible for developing and creatively calling on a prospect pipeline through an existing portfolio of brands and agencies, network referrals, and cold calls, for potential partnership opportunities with regional, national, and international organizations
• Collaborate with Strategy & Solutions and Brand Marketing teams to develop customized marketing platforms and materials that align with prospective partner's brand/business objectives
• Establish and build relationships with client stakeholders in addition to key prospects
• Prepare for and lead client calls, property update meetings, and internal Partnership Development discussions / support the Head of Partnership Development
• Deliver regular sales forecasting and pipeline reporting for Allied Sports internal leadership and clients
• Ensure, in conjunction with finance team, execution, management, and fulfillment of client agreements, particularly timely payments of receivables
• Collaborate with other Allied Sports teams to achieve company’s overall goals and objectives

Qualifications
• Minimum of 8 years of relevant experience in the sports/media industries including a strong track record in major property sponsorship sales
• Highly motivated, proactive, self-starter
• Deep understanding of the sports marketing and media landscape
• Strong contacts with decision-makers of global, national, and regional brands
• Proven ability to prospect, cultivate, negotiate, and close major sponsorship agreements
• Ability to think strategically and creatively, and to communicate such thoughts proactively, efficiently, and compassionately
• Ability to problem-solve independently and in groups
• Ability to manage multiple projects, tasks and priorities at once
• Excellent time management, relationship, written and oral communication skills
• Ability to cultivate and develop internal talent
• Collaborative, team-player with an inclusive and results-driven mindset
• Ability to travel and work non-traditional hours occasionally as needed (which could include weekends)
• Proficient in Microsoft suite

Industry

Sports Partnership Development

Employment Type

Full-time

Salary Range

$125,000-$150,000 annual
